instruction: How were the machine learning models utilized in the related study on using UAV-based HSI for PWD early monitoring in Pinus koraiensis stands?
Output: In the related study on using UAV-based HSI for PWD early monitoring in Pinus koraiensis stands, the machine learning model used was the Random Forest (RF) classification algorithm. The RF classifier was employed to examine the separability between two groups of trees - control trees and infested trees. The spectral features of each tree crown, including spectral reflectance, first and second-order spectral derivatives, and vegetation indices (VIs), were analyzed. The RF classifier was then used to successfully separate the two groups of trees based on the HSI data from July to October, achieving an overall classification accuracy of 0.75-0.95.
